pokemons.name: bulbasaur
pokemons.description: Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun’s rays, the seed grows progressively larger.

pokemons.name: ivysaur
pokemons.description: There is a bud on this Pokémon’s back. If it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight, it’s a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon.

pokemons.name: venusaur
pokemons.description: There is a large flower on Venusaur’s back. The flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower’s aroma soothes the emotions of people.

pokemons.name: venusaur-mega
pokemons.description: There is a large flower on Venusaur’s back. The flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower’s aroma soothes the emotions of people.

pokemons.name: charmander
pokemons.description: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.

pokemons.name: charmeleon
pokemons.description: Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive. In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color.

pokemons.name: charizard
pokemons.description: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.

pokemons.name: charizard-mega-y
pokemons.description: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.

pokemons.name: charizard-mega-x
pokemons.description: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.

pokemons.name: squirtle
pokemons.description: Squirtle’s shell is not merely used for protection. The shell’s rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pokémon to swim at high speeds.

pokemons.name: wartortle
pokemons.description: Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon’s toughness as a battler.

pokemons.name: blastoise
pokemons.description: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.

pokemons.name: blastoise-mega
pokemons.description: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.

pokemons.name: caterpie
pokemons.description: It’s easy to catch, and it grows quickly, making it one of the top recommendations for novice Pokémon Trainers.

pokemons.name: metapod
pokemons.description: Its shell is hard, but it’s still just a bug shell. It’s been known to break, so intense battles with it should be avoided.

pokemons.name: butterfree
pokemons.description: When attacked by other Pokémon, it defends itself by scattering its poisonous scales and fluttering its wings.

pokemons.name: weedle
pokemons.description: Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable of distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).

pokemons.name: kakuna
pokemons.description: Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree. However, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares for its coming evolution. This is evident from how hot the shell becomes to the touch.

pokemons.name: beedrill
pokemons.description: Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach its nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack in a furious swarm.

pokemons.name: beedrill-mega
pokemons.description: Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach its nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack in a furious swarm.

pokemons.name: pidgey
pokemons.description: Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.

pokemons.name: pidgeotto
pokemons.description: Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This Pokémon flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.

pokemons.name: pidgeot
pokemons.description: This Pokémon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.

pokemons.name: pidgeot-mega
pokemons.description: This Pokémon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.

pokemons.name: rattata
pokemons.description: With their strong capacity for survival, they can live in dirty places without concern. Left unchecked, their numbers multiply rapidly.

pokemons.name: raticate
pokemons.description: Its disposition is far more violent than its looks would suggest. Don’t let your hand get too close to its face, as it could bite your hand clean off.

pokemons.name: spearow
pokemons.description: Farmers whose fields are troubled by bug Pokémon appreciate Spearow for its vigorous appetite and look after it.

pokemons.name: fearow
pokemons.description: Drawings of a Pokémon resembling Fearow can be seen in murals from deep in ancient history.

pokemons.name: ekans
pokemons.description: Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a glare from its upraised head.

pokemons.name: arbok
pokemons.description: This Pokémon is terrifically strong in order to constrict things with its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once Arbok wraps its body around its foe, escaping its crunching embrace is impossible.

pokemons.name: pikachu
pokemons.description: It’s in its nature to store electricity. It feels stressed now and then if it’s unable to fully discharge the electricity.

pokemons.name: raichu
pokemons.description: It becomes aggressive when it has electricity stored up. At such times, even its Trainer has to take care to avoid being attacked.

pokemons.name: sandshrew
pokemons.description: It usually makes its home in deserts and arid zones, where rain does not fall. It digs holes to catch Bug-type Pokémon.

pokemons.name: sandslash
pokemons.description: It uses its claws to climb trees and then curls its body into a spiny ball, ready to drop onto any prey that appears.

pokemons.name: nidoran-f
pokemons.description: Nidoran♀ has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pokémon. When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.

pokemons.name: nidorina
pokemons.description: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pokémon appears to become nervous if separated from the others.

pokemons.name: nidoqueen
pokemons.description: Nidoqueen’s body is encased in extremely hard scales. It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles. This Pokémon is at its strongest when it is defending its young.

pokemons.name: nidoran-m
pokemons.description: Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pokémon’s notice.

pokemons.name: nidorino
pokemons.description: Nidorino has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might.

pokemons.name: nidoking
pokemons.description: Nidoking’s thick tail packs enormously destructive power. With one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower. Once this Pokémon goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.

pokemons.name: clefairy
pokemons.description: On nights with a full moon, they gather together and dance. The surrounding area is enveloped in an abnormal magnetic field.

pokemons.name: clefable
pokemons.description: According to tradition, people who see a pair of Clefable skipping by can look forward to a happy marriage.

pokemons.name: vulpix
pokemons.description: From its mouth spew flames that seem to resemble the spirits of the deceased. Some people mistakenly think this fire is a ghost.

pokemons.name: ninetales
pokemons.description: Said to live for a thousand years, this Pokémon uses its supernatural abilities to manipulate fire. It can burn its prey to a crisp as it pleases.

pokemons.name: jigglypuff
pokemons.description: Jigglypuff possess a vocal range that exceeds 12 octaves, but each individual’s singing skill depends on its own effort.

pokemons.name: wigglytuff
pokemons.description: As it inhales, it expands...and expands...and expands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one can inflate itself the most.

pokemons.name: zubat
pokemons.description: When exposed to sunlight, they suffer burns. The frequency of their ultrasonic waves can differ slightly from colony to colony.

pokemons.name: golbat
pokemons.description: Sometimes they drink so much blood, they can’t fly anymore. Then they fall to the ground and become food for other Pokémon.

pokemons.name: oddish
pokemons.description: Oddish searches for fertile, nutrient-rich soil, then plants itself. During the daytime, while it is planted, this Pokémon’s feet are thought to change shape and become similar to the roots of trees.

pokemons.name: gloom
pokemons.description: From its mouth Gloom drips honey that smells absolutely horrible. Apparently, it loves the horrid stench. It sniffs the noxious fumes and then drools even more of its honey.

pokemons.name: vileplume
pokemons.description: Vileplume has the world’s largest petals. They are used to attract prey that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the prey are immobilized, this Pokémon catches and devours them.

pokemons.name: paras
pokemons.description: Mushrooms called tochukaso sprout from its back. They can be dried and powdered to make a medicine used to extend life.

pokemons.name: parasect
pokemons.description: It scatters toxic spores from its mushroom cap. Once harvested, these spores can be steeped and boiled down to prepare herbal medicines.

pokemons.name: venonat
pokemons.description: Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey.

pokemons.name: venomoth
pokemons.description: Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.

pokemons.name: diglett
pokemons.description: Many farmers cherish and nurture Diglett because its droppings enrich the soil it lives in.

pokemons.name: dugtrio
pokemons.description: Despite the closeness between this Pokémon and farmers and other people, no one has ever seen the parts of it concealed underground.

pokemons.name: meowth
pokemons.description: It loves shiny things. It often fights with Murkrow over prey they’re both trying to catch.

pokemons.name: persian
pokemons.description: It has a high opinion of itself, although not to the same extent as the Alolan Persian. It’s quite difficult to make friends with this Pokémon.

pokemons.name: psyduck
pokemons.description: This Pokémon is troubled by constant headaches. The more pain it’s in, the more powerful its psychokinesis becomes.

pokemons.name: golduck
pokemons.description: It swims along the banks of lakes and catches fish Pokémon. It takes them to the shore and quietly eats them up.

pokemons.name: mankey
pokemons.description: Its raging tires it out and causes it to fall asleep, but the anger resonating in its dreams causes it to wake up—which infuriates it all over again.

pokemons.name: primeape
pokemons.description: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.

pokemons.name: growlithe
pokemons.description: It looks cute, but when you approach another Trainer’s Growlithe, it will bark at you and bite.

pokemons.name: arcanine
pokemons.description: The fire burning inside its body serves as the energy to fuel it as it runs great distances. It appears in many legends.

pokemons.name: poliwag
pokemons.description: It’s still not very good at walking. Its Trainers should train this Pokémon to walk every day.

pokemons.name: poliwhirl
pokemons.description: It marches over the land in search of bug Pokémon to eat. Then it takes them underwater so it can dine on them where it’s safe.

pokemons.name: poliwrath
pokemons.description: Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its body is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy and forces its swimming prowess to develop.

pokemons.name: abra
pokemons.description: It can teleport itself to safety while it’s asleep, but when it wakes, it doesn’t know where it is, so it panics.

pokemons.name: kadabra
pokemons.description: Kadabra’s presence infests televisions and monitors with creepy shadows that bring bad luck.

pokemons.name: alakazam
pokemons.description: Its brain cells continue to increase in number until its death. The older the Alakazam, the larger its head.

pokemons.name: alakazam-mega
pokemons.description: Its brain cells continue to increase in number until its death. The older the Alakazam, the larger its head.

pokemons.name: machop
pokemons.description: With its superhuman strength, it’s able to throw a hundred people all at the same time. Its strength comes from lifting Graveler every day.

pokemons.name: machoke
pokemons.description: It willingly assists with hard labor because it knows the work is good training for its muscles.

pokemons.name: machamp
pokemons.description: It can lift heavy loads with the greatest of ease. It can even heft dump trucks. But its clumsy fingers prevent it from doing any precision work.

pokemons.name: bellsprout
pokemons.description: Bellsprout’s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pokémon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.

pokemons.name: weepinbell
pokemons.description: Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the Pokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.

pokemons.name: victreebel
pokemons.description: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pokémon swallows it whole.

pokemons.name: tentacool
pokemons.description: It drifts in shallow seas, such as the areas near beaches. If you get bitten or stabbed by its toxic tentacles, rush to the hospital.

pokemons.name: tentacruel
pokemons.description: Although these Pokémon are rare, when a large outbreak of them occurs, all fish Pokémon disappear from the surrounding sea.

pokemons.name: geodude
pokemons.description: There are plenty of them to be found along any road. A scholar with too much free time once counted a hundred of them along a single route.

pokemons.name: graveler
pokemons.description: This slow-footed Pokémon moves by curling up and rolling instead of walking. With enough momentum, its speed can exceed 60 mph.

pokemons.name: golem
pokemons.description: Once a year, this Pokémon molts, and its shed shell returns to the soil. This process creates enriched soil, so farmers collect the shells.

pokemons.name: ponyta
pokemons.description: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.

pokemons.name: rapidash
pokemons.description: Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.

pokemons.name: slowpoke
pokemons.description: Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke tails and then simmering them into a salty stew.

pokemons.name: slowbro
pokemons.description: Whenever Shellder bites down hard on its tail, it gives Slowbro a flash of inspiration...which it forgets a moment later.

pokemons.name: slowbro-mega
pokemons.description: Whenever Shellder bites down hard on its tail, it gives Slowbro a flash of inspiration...which it forgets a moment later.

pokemons.name: magnemite
pokemons.description: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it’s eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.

pokemons.name: magneton
pokemons.description: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.

pokemons.name: farfetchd
pokemons.description: Farfetch’d is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This Pokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.

pokemons.name: doduo
pokemons.description: Doduo’s two heads contain completely identical brains. A scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be examples of this Pokémon possessing different sets of brains.

pokemons.name: dodrio
pokemons.description: Apparently, the heads aren’t the only parts of the body that Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.

pokemons.name: seel
pokemons.description: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.

pokemons.name: dewgong
pokemons.description: Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.

pokemons.name: grimer
pokemons.description: It was born from sludge transformed by exposure to X-rays from the moon. When its internal load of germs decreases, it dies.

pokemons.name: muk
pokemons.description: After recent environmental improvements, this Pokémon is now hardly seen at all. People speculate that it may go extinct at some point.

pokemons.name: shellder
pokemons.description: This Pokémon’s tongue is always hanging out. It uses its tongue with great dexterity to dig up sand from the seabed in its search for food.

pokemons.name: cloyster
pokemons.description: Excavation of the tombs of ancient hunting tribes has turned up many spears tipped with spikes that had fallen off this Pokémon’s shell.

pokemons.name: gastly
pokemons.description: Although Gastly is barely visible, when it’s near, a faint sweet smell lingers.

pokemons.name: haunter
pokemons.description: It fears the light and revels in the dark. It may be on the verge of extinction in cities that stay brightly lit at night.

pokemons.name: gengar
pokemons.description: It apparently wishes for a traveling companion. Since it was once human itself, it tries to create one by taking the lives of other humans.

pokemons.name: gengar-mega
pokemons.description: It apparently wishes for a traveling companion. Since it was once human itself, it tries to create one by taking the lives of other humans.

pokemons.name: onix
pokemons.description: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.

pokemons.name: drowzee
pokemons.description: It finds really fun dreams tasty. When it makes friends with people, it may show them the most delicious dreams it’s ever eaten.

pokemons.name: hypno
pokemons.description: As a matter of course, it makes anyone it meets fall asleep and has a taste of their dreams. Anyone having a good dream, it carries off.

pokemons.name: krabby
pokemons.description: Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food, these Pokémon can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.

pokemons.name: kingler
pokemons.description: Kingler has an enormous, oversized claw. It waves this huge claw in the air to communicate with others. However, because the claw is so heavy, the Pokémon quickly tires.

pokemons.name: voltorb
pokemons.description: Voltorb is extremely sensitive—it explodes at the slightest of shocks. It is rumored that it was first created when a Poké Ball was exposed to a powerful pulse of energy.

pokemons.name: electrode
pokemons.description: One of Electrode’s characteristics is its attraction to electricity. It is a problematical Pokémon that congregates mostly at electrical power plants to feed on electricity that has just been generated.

pokemons.name: exeggcute
pokemons.description: Six of them together form a full-fledged Pokémon. It’s often hunted by Crabrawler, but uses psychokinesis to drive it off.

pokemons.name: exeggutor
pokemons.description: When the time comes, one of its three heads falls off. Before long, the fallen head grows into an Exeggcute.

pokemons.name: cubone
pokemons.description: The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead mother. According to some, it will evolve when it comes to terms with the pain of her death.

pokemons.name: marowak
pokemons.description: This Pokémon is out for vengeance on its natural enemy, Mandibuzz. It throws bones like boomerangs to try to take it down.

pokemons.name: hitmonlee
pokemons.description: Hitmonlee’s legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.

pokemons.name: hitmonchan
pokemons.description: Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had been working toward a world championship. This Pokémon has an indomitable spirit and will never give up in the face of adversity.

pokemons.name: lickitung
pokemons.description: Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.

pokemons.name: koffing
pokemons.description: Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas is concocted by this Pokémon.

pokemons.name: weezing
pokemons.description: Weezing alternately shrinks and inflates its twin bodies to mix together toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed, the more powerful the toxins become. The Pokémon also becomes more putrid.

pokemons.name: rhyhorn
pokemons.description: Rhyhorn’s brain is very small. It is so dense, while on a run it forgets why it started running in the first place. It apparently remembers sometimes if it demolishes something.

pokemons.name: rhydon
pokemons.description: Rhydon has a horn that serves as a drill. It is used for destroying rocks and boulders. This Pokémon occasionally rams into streams of magma, but the armor-like hide prevents it from feeling the heat.

pokemons.name: chansey
pokemons.description: Not only are these Pokémon fast runners, they’re also few in number, so anyone who finds one must be lucky indeed.

pokemons.name: tangela
pokemons.description: Tangela’s vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.

pokemons.name: kangaskhan
pokemons.description: The child in its pouch leaves home after roughly three years. That is the only time the mother is heard to cry wildly.

pokemons.name: kangaskhan-mega
pokemons.description: The child in its pouch leaves home after roughly three years. That is the only time the mother is heard to cry wildly.

pokemons.name: horsea
pokemons.description: If Horsea senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This Pokémon swims by cleverly flapping the fin on its back.

pokemons.name: seadra
pokemons.description: Seadra generates whirlpools by spinning its body. The whirlpools are strong enough to swallow even fishing boats. This Pokémon weakens prey with these currents, then swallows it whole.

pokemons.name: goldeen
pokemons.description: Spellbound by the length of its horn and the beauty of its fins, many strange Trainers raise Goldeen and nothing but Goldeen.

pokemons.name: seaking
pokemons.description: Trainers who are crazy for Seaking are divided into horn enthusiasts and fin enthusiasts. The two groups do not get along well.

pokemons.name: staryu
pokemons.description: This Pokémon gets nibbled on by Lumineon and others. Thanks to its red core, it regenerates fast, so it’s unconcerned by their snack attacks.

pokemons.name: starmie
pokemons.description: Its unusual body shape, reminiscent of abstract art, led local people to spread rumors that this Pokémon may be an invader from outer space.

pokemons.name: mr-mime
pokemons.description: Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists as if it were real.

pokemons.name: scyther
pokemons.description: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.

pokemons.name: jynx
pokemons.description: Jynx walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without giving any thought to what they are doing.

pokemons.name: electabuzz
pokemons.description: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.

pokemons.name: magmar
pokemons.description: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn’t calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.

pokemons.name: pinsir
pokemons.description: One solid blow from its horns is enough to split apart a large tree. Its greatest rival in Alola is Vikavolt.

pokemons.name: pinsir-mega
pokemons.description: One solid blow from its horns is enough to split apart a large tree. Its greatest rival in Alola is Vikavolt.

pokemons.name: tauros
pokemons.description: Although it’s known to be a fierce Pokémon, Tauros in the Alola region are said to possess a measure of calmness.

pokemons.name: magikarp
pokemons.description: Its reckless leaps make it easy pickings for predators. On the bright side, many Pokémon enjoy longer life spans, thanks to Magikarp.

pokemons.name: gyarados
pokemons.description: There are people who swear that any place Gyarados appears is fated for destruction.

pokemons.name: gyarados-mega
pokemons.description: There are people who swear that any place Gyarados appears is fated for destruction.

pokemons.name: lapras
pokemons.description: These Pokémon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.

pokemons.name: ditto
pokemons.description: With its astonishing capacity for metamorphosis, it can get along with anything. It does not get along well with its fellow Ditto.

pokemons.name: eevee
pokemons.description: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.

pokemons.name: vaporeon
pokemons.description: Blending in with the water and erasing all signs of its presence, it patiently waits for its prey, fish Pokémon.

pokemons.name: jolteon
pokemons.description: When its fur stands on end, that’s a sign it’s about to give off a jolt of electricity. Take care, as sometimes lightning strikes next to it, too.

pokemons.name: flareon
pokemons.description: Its average body temperature is between 1,300 and 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. In its internal flame sac, temperatures reach 3,000 degrees.

pokemons.name: porygon
pokemons.description: It can convert its body into digital data, which enables it to enter cyberspace.

pokemons.name: omanyte
pokemons.description: Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokémon that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.

pokemons.name: omastar
pokemons.description: Omastar uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large and heavy, causing its movements to become too slow and ponderous.

pokemons.name: kabuto
pokemons.description: Kabuto is a Pokémon that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in extremely rare cases, living examples have been discovered. The Pokémon has not changed at all for 300 million years.

pokemons.name: kabutops
pokemons.description: Kabutops swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient times. The Pokémon was apparently evolving from being a water dweller to living on land as evident from the beginnings of change in its gills and legs.

pokemons.name: aerodactyl
pokemons.description: In ancient times, it ruled the skies. A widely accepted theory is that it went extinct due to a large meteor impact.

pokemons.name: aerodactyl-mega
pokemons.description: In ancient times, it ruled the skies. A widely accepted theory is that it went extinct due to a large meteor impact.

pokemons.name: snorlax
pokemons.description: It eats nearly 900 pounds of food every day. It starts nodding off while eating—and continues to eat even while it’s asleep.

pokemons.name: articuno
pokemons.description: Articuno is a legendary bird Pokémon that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this Pokémon flies, snow will fall.

pokemons.name: zapdos
pokemons.description: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. The Pokémon gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.

pokemons.name: moltres
pokemons.description: Moltres is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control fire. If this Pokémon is injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.

pokemons.name: dratini
pokemons.description: After a 10-hour struggle, a fisherman was able to pull one up and confirm its existence.

pokemons.name: dragonair
pokemons.description: From time immemorial, it has been venerated by agricultural peoples as an entity able to control the weather.

pokemons.name: dragonite
pokemons.description: Incur the wrath of this normally calm Pokémon at your peril, because it will smash everything to smithereens before it’s satisfied.

pokemons.name: mewtwo
pokemons.description: Mewtwo is a Pokémon that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans created this Pokémon’s body, they failed to endow Mewtwo with a compassionate heart.

pokemons.name: mewtwo-mega-x
pokemons.description: Mewtwo is a Pokémon that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans created this Pokémon’s body, they failed to endow Mewtwo with a compassionate heart.

pokemons.name: mewtwo-mega-y
pokemons.description: Mewtwo is a Pokémon that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans created this Pokémon’s body, they failed to endow Mewtwo with a compassionate heart.

pokemons.name: mew
pokemons.description: Mew is said to possess the genetic composition of all Pokémon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.

pokemons.name: chikorita
pokemons.description: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.

pokemons.name: bayleef
pokemons.description: Bayleef’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.

pokemons.name: meganium
pokemons.description: The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.

pokemons.name: cyndaquil
pokemons.description: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.

pokemons.name: quilava
pokemons.description: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.

pokemons.name: typhlosion
pokemons.description: Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokémon creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.

pokemons.name: totodile
pokemons.description: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.

pokemons.name: croconaw
pokemons.description: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.

pokemons.name: feraligatr
pokemons.description: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.

pokemons.name: sentret
pokemons.description: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.

pokemons.name: furret
pokemons.description: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.

pokemons.name: hoothoot
pokemons.description: Hoothoot has an internal organ that senses and tracks the earth’s rotation. Using this special organ, this Pokémon begins hooting at precisely the same time every day.

pokemons.name: noctowl
pokemons.description: Noctowl never fails at catching prey in darkness. This Pokémon owes its success to its superior vision that allows it to see in minimal light, and to its soft, supple wings that make no sound in flight.

pokemons.name: ledyba
pokemons.description: They communicate with one another using bodily fluids that give off odors. When they’re angry, their odor smells sour.

pokemons.name: ledian
pokemons.description: In battle, it throws punches with all four arms. The power of each individual blow is piddly, so it aims to win by quantity rather than quality.

pokemons.name: spinarak
pokemons.description: Some fishermen weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokémon.

pokemons.name: ariados
pokemons.description: It spins thread from both its rear and its mouth. Then it wraps its prey up in thread and sips their bodily fluids at its leisure.

pokemons.name: crobat
pokemons.description: Silent and swift in its four-winged flight, it bites down on its prey before they realize what’s happening. In a heartbeat, it drains their blood.

pokemons.name: chinchou
pokemons.description: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.

pokemons.name: lanturn
pokemons.description: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

pokemons.name: pichu
pokemons.description: Despite this Pokémon’s cute appearance, those who want to live with one should prepare to be on the receiving end of its electric jolts.

pokemons.name: cleffa
pokemons.description: Because of its silhouette, it’s believed to be a star reborn. For some reason, it loves Minior.

pokemons.name: igglybuff
pokemons.description: It moves by bouncing along. As it moves a lot, it sweats, and its body gives off a sweet aroma.

pokemons.name: togepi
pokemons.description: As its energy, Togepi uses the positive emotions of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and Pokémon. This Pokémon stores up feelings of happiness inside its shell, then shares them with others.

pokemons.name: togetic
pokemons.description: Togetic is said to be a Pokémon that brings good fortune. When the Pokémon spots someone who is pure of heart, it is said to appear and share its happiness with that person.

pokemons.name: natu
pokemons.description: Natu has a highly developed jumping ability. The Pokémon flaps and leaps onto tree branches that are taller than grown-up people to pick at the tree’s new shoots.

pokemons.name: xatu
pokemons.description: Xatu is known to stand motionless while staring at the sun all day long. Some people revere it as a mystical Pokémon out of their belief that Xatu is in possession of the power to see into the future.

pokemons.name: mareep
pokemons.description: Mareep’s fluffy coat of wool rubs together and builds a static charge. The more static electricity is charged, the more brightly the lightbulb at the tip of its tail glows.

pokemons.name: flaaffy
pokemons.description: Flaaffy’s wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.

pokemons.name: ampharos
pokemons.description: Ampharos gives off so much light that it can be seen even from space. People in the old days used the light of this Pokémon to send signals back and forth with others far away.

pokemons.name: ampharos-mega
pokemons.description: Ampharos gives off so much light that it can be seen even from space. People in the old days used the light of this Pokémon to send signals back and forth with others far away.

pokemons.name: bellossom
pokemons.description: A Bellossom grows flowers more beautifully if it has evolved from a smelly Gloom—the more stinky the better. At night, this Pokémon closes its petals and goes to sleep.

pokemons.name: marill
pokemons.description: When fishing for food at the edge of a fast-running stream, Marill wraps its tail around the trunk of a tree. This Pokémon’s tail is flexible and configured to stretch.

pokemons.name: azumarill
pokemons.description: Azumarill can make balloons out of air. It makes these air balloons if it spots a drowning Pokémon. The air balloons enable the Pokémon in trouble to breathe.

pokemons.name: sudowoodo
pokemons.description: Apparently, the larger the green parts of this Pokémon, the more collectors value it. It’s a particular favorite among elderly people.

pokemons.name: politoed
pokemons.description: It’s the leader of Poliwag and Poliwhirl. When Politoed roars, they all cower in fear.

pokemons.name: hoppip
pokemons.description: This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.

pokemons.name: skiploom
pokemons.description: Skiploom’s flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon is sometimes used as a thermometer.

pokemons.name: jumpluff
pokemons.description: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.

pokemons.name: aipom
pokemons.description: Aipom’s tail ends in a hand-like appendage that can be cleverly manipulated. However, because the Pokémon uses its tail so much, its real hands have become rather clumsy.

pokemons.name: sunkern
pokemons.description: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.

pokemons.name: sunflora
pokemons.description: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.

pokemons.name: yanma
pokemons.description: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.

pokemons.name: wooper
pokemons.description: Wooper usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes out onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with a gooey, toxic film.

pokemons.name: quagsire
pokemons.description: Quagsire hunts for food by leaving its mouth wide open in water and waiting for its prey to blunder in unaware. Because the Pokémon does not move, it does not get very hungry.

pokemons.name: espeon
pokemons.description: It unleashes psychic power from the orb on its forehead. When its power is exhausted, the orb grows dull and dark.

pokemons.name: umbreon
pokemons.description: With its black fur, it blends into the darkness. It bides its time, and when prey appears, this Pokémon goes for its throat, and then eats it.

pokemons.name: murkrow
pokemons.description: Seen as a symbol of bad luck, it’s generally disliked. Yet it gives presents—objects that sparkle or shine—to Trainers it’s close to.

pokemons.name: slowking
pokemons.description: This Pokémon is so famed for its intellect that a proverb still persists in some regions: “When in doubt, ask Slowking.”

pokemons.name: misdreavus
pokemons.description: If you hear a sobbing sound emanating from a vacant room, it’s undoubtedly a bit of mischief from Misdreavus.

pokemons.name: unown
pokemons.description: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.

pokemons.name: wobbuffet
pokemons.description: Wobbuffet does nothing but endure attacks—it won’t attack on its own. However, it won’t endure an attack on its tail. When that happens, the Pokémon will try to take the foe with it using Destiny Bond.

pokemons.name: girafarig
pokemons.description: Girafarig’s rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn’t need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.

pokemons.name: pineco
pokemons.description: Pineco hangs from a tree branch and patiently waits for prey to come along. If the Pokémon is disturbed while eating by someone shaking its tree, it drops down to the ground and explodes with no warning.

pokemons.name: forretress
pokemons.description: Forretress conceals itself inside its hardened steel shell. The shell is opened when the Pokémon is catching prey, but it does so at such a quick pace that the shell’s inside cannot be seen.

pokemons.name: dunsparce
pokemons.description: Dunsparce has a drill for its tail. It uses this tail to burrow into the ground backward. This Pokémon is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.

pokemons.name: gligar
pokemons.description: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.

pokemons.name: steelix
pokemons.description: Steelix lives even further underground than Onix. This Pokémon is known to dig toward the earth’s core. There are records of this Pokémon reaching a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.

pokemons.name: steelix-mega
pokemons.description: Steelix lives even further underground than Onix. This Pokémon is known to dig toward the earth’s core. There are records of this Pokémon reaching a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.

pokemons.name: snubbull
pokemons.description: Its growls make its opponents uneasy. This laid-back Pokémon tends to sleep half the day.

pokemons.name: granbull
pokemons.description: More timid than Snubbull, this Pokémon is doted on by young people amused at the contrast between its looks and its attitude.

pokemons.name: qwilfish
pokemons.description: Qwilfish sucks in water, inflating itself. This Pokémon uses the pressure of the water it swallowed to shoot toxic quills all at once from all over its body. It finds swimming somewhat challenging.

pokemons.name: scizor
pokemons.description: Once it has identified an enemy, this Pokémon smashes it mercilessly with pincers hard as steel.

pokemons.name: scizor-mega
pokemons.description: Once it has identified an enemy, this Pokémon smashes it mercilessly with pincers hard as steel.

pokemons.name: shuckle
pokemons.description: Shuckle quietly hides itself under rocks, keeping its body concealed inside its hard shell while eating berries it has stored away. The berries mix with its body fluids to become a juice.

pokemons.name: heracross
pokemons.description: Heracross has sharp claws on its feet. These are planted firmly into the ground or the bark of a tree, giving the Pokémon a secure and solid footing to forcefully fling away foes with its proud horn.

pokemons.name: heracross-mega
pokemons.description: Heracross has sharp claws on its feet. These are planted firmly into the ground or the bark of a tree, giving the Pokémon a secure and solid footing to forcefully fling away foes with its proud horn.

pokemons.name: sneasel
pokemons.description: It uses its claws to poke holes in eggs so it can slurp out the insides. Breeders consider it a scourge and will drive it away or eradicate it.

pokemons.name: teddiursa
pokemons.description: This Pokémon likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.

pokemons.name: ursaring
pokemons.description: In the forests inhabited by Ursaring, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This Pokémon walks through its forest gathering food every day.

pokemons.name: slugma
pokemons.description: Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokémon’s body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.

pokemons.name: magcargo
pokemons.description: Magcargo’s body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Water is vaporized on contact. If this Pokémon is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.

pokemons.name: swinub
pokemons.description: Swinub roots for food by rubbing its snout against the ground. Its favorite food is a mushroom that grows under the cover of dead grass. This Pokémon occasionally roots out hot springs.

pokemons.name: piloswine
pokemons.description: Piloswine is covered by a thick coat of long hair that enables it to endure the freezing cold. This Pokémon uses its tusks to dig up food that has been buried under ice.

pokemons.name: corsola
pokemons.description: Pursued by Mareanie for the branches on its head, this Pokémon will sometimes snap its own branches off as a diversion while it escapes.

pokemons.name: remoraid
pokemons.description: Remoraid sucks in water, then expels it at high velocity using its abdominal muscles to shoot down flying prey. When evolution draws near, this Pokémon travels downstream from rivers.

pokemons.name: octillery
pokemons.description: Octillery grabs onto its foe using its tentacles. This Pokémon tries to immobilize it before delivering the finishing blow. If the foe turns out to be too strong, Octillery spews ink to escape.

pokemons.name: delibird
pokemons.description: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokémon, so it’s always scrounging around for more food.

pokemons.name: mantine
pokemons.description: On sunny days, schools of Mantine can be seen elegantly leaping over the sea’s waves. This Pokémon is not bothered by the Remoraid that hitches rides.

pokemons.name: skarmory
pokemons.description: Its metal body is sturdy, but it does rust rather easily. So on rainy days, this Pokémon prefers to stay put in its nest.

pokemons.name: houndour
pokemons.description: Houndour hunt as a coordinated pack. They communicate with each other using a variety of cries to corner their prey. This Pokémon’s remarkable teamwork is unparalleled.

pokemons.name: houndoom
pokemons.description: In a Houndoom pack, the one with its horns raked sharply toward the back serves a leadership role. These Pokémon choose their leader by fighting among themselves.

pokemons.name: houndoom-mega
pokemons.description: In a Houndoom pack, the one with its horns raked sharply toward the back serves a leadership role. These Pokémon choose their leader by fighting among themselves.

pokemons.name: kingdra
pokemons.description: Kingdra sleeps on the seafloor where it is otherwise devoid of life. When a storm arrives, the Pokémon is said to awaken and wander about in search of prey.

pokemons.name: phanpy
pokemons.description: Phanpy uses its long nose to shower itself. When others gather around, they thoroughly douse each other with water. These Pokémon can be seen drying their soaking-wet bodies at the edge of water.

pokemons.name: donphan
pokemons.description: If Donphan were to tackle with its hard body, even a house could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the Pokémon helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.

pokemons.name: porygon2
pokemons.description: Porygon was updated to a new version in readiness for planetary development. But that dream remains unrealized as yet.

pokemons.name: stantler
pokemons.description: Stantler’s magnificent antlers were traded at high prices as works of art. As a result, this Pokémon was hunted close to extinction by those who were after the priceless antlers.

pokemons.name: smeargle
pokemons.description: It draws symbols all over the place to mark its territory. In towns with many Smeargle, the walls are covered in graffiti.

pokemons.name: tyrogue
pokemons.description: Tyrogue becomes stressed out if it does not get to train every day. When raising this Pokémon, the Trainer must establish and uphold various training methods.

pokemons.name: hitmontop
pokemons.description: Hitmontop spins on its head at high speed, all the while delivering kicks. This technique is a remarkable mix of both offense and defense at the same time. The Pokémon travels faster spinning than it does walking.

pokemons.name: smoochum
pokemons.description: Smoochum actively runs about, but also falls quite often. Whenever the chance arrives, it will look for its reflection to make sure its face hasn’t become dirty.

pokemons.name: elekid
pokemons.description: This Pokémon is constantly fighting with Togedemaru that try to steal its electricity. It’s a pretty even match.

pokemons.name: magby
pokemons.description: A famous potter lives with a Magby. Apparently its soft flames produce fine works.

pokemons.name: miltank
pokemons.description: Most people raise it for its milk, but it’s quite tough and strong, so it’s also well suited for battle.

pokemons.name: blissey
pokemons.description: Its fluffy fur coat acts as a sensor, enabling it to read the feelings of people and Pokémon.

pokemons.name: raikou
pokemons.description: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.

pokemons.name: entei
pokemons.description: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.

pokemons.name: suicune
pokemons.description: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.

pokemons.name: larvitar
pokemons.description: Larvitar is born deep under the ground. To come up to the surface, this Pokémon must eat its way through the soil above. Until it does so, Larvitar cannot see its parents.

pokemons.name: pupitar
pokemons.description: Pupitar creates a gas inside its body that it compresses and forcefully ejects to propel itself like a jet. The body is very durable—it avoids damage even if it hits solid steel.

pokemons.name: tyranitar
pokemons.description: Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a whole mountain to make its nest. This Pokémon wanders about in mountains seeking new opponents to fight.

pokemons.name: tyranitar-mega
pokemons.description: Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a whole mountain to make its nest. This Pokémon wanders about in mountains seeking new opponents to fight.

pokemons.name: lugia
pokemons.description: Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.

pokemons.name: ho-oh
pokemons.description: Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.

pokemons.name: celebi
pokemons.description: This Pokémon came from the future by crossing over time. It is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.

pokemons.name: treecko
pokemons.description: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.

pokemons.name: grovyle
pokemons.description: This Pokémon adeptly flies from branch to branch in trees. In a forest, no Pokémon can ever hope to catch a fleeing Grovyle however fast they may be.

pokemons.name: sceptile
pokemons.description: Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon raises the trees in a forest with loving care.

pokemons.name: sceptile-mega
pokemons.description: Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon raises the trees in a forest with loving care.

pokemons.name: torchic
pokemons.description: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.

pokemons.name: combusken
pokemons.description: Combusken battles with the intensely hot flames it spews from its beak and with outstandingly destructive kicks. This Pokémon’s cry is very loud and distracting.

pokemons.name: blaziken
pokemons.description: Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon’s blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.

pokemons.name: blaziken-mega
pokemons.description: Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon’s blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.

pokemons.name: mudkip
pokemons.description: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.

pokemons.name: marshtomp
pokemons.description: Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at swimming. This Pokémon’s hindquarters exhibit obvious development, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.

pokemons.name: swampert
pokemons.description: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.

pokemons.name: swampert-mega
pokemons.description: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.

pokemons.name: poochyena
pokemons.description: Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This Pokémon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.

pokemons.name: mightyena
pokemons.description: Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory of its life in the wild compels the Pokémon to obey only those Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.

pokemons.name: zigzagoon
pokemons.description: The hair on Zigzagoon’s back is bristly. It rubs the hard back hair against trees to leave its territorial markings. This Pokémon may play dead to fool foes in battle.

pokemons.name: linoone
pokemons.description: When hunting, Linoone will make a beeline straight for the prey at a full run. While this Pokémon is capable of topping 60 mph, it has to come to a screeching halt before it can turn.

pokemons.name: wurmple
pokemons.description: Wurmple is targeted by Swellow as prey. This Pokémon will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.

pokemons.name: silcoon
pokemons.description: Silcoon was thought to endure hunger and not consume anything before its evolution. However, it is now thought that this Pokémon slakes its thirst by drinking rainwater that collects on its silk.

pokemons.name: beautifly
pokemons.description: Beautifly has a long mouth like a coiled needle, which is very convenient for collecting pollen from flowers. This Pokémon rides the spring winds as it flits around gathering pollen.

pokemons.name: cascoon
pokemons.description: If it is attacked, Cascoon remains motionless however badly it may be hurt. It does so because if it were to move, its body would be weak upon evolution. This Pokémon will also not forget the pain it endured.

pokemons.name: dustox
pokemons.description: When Dustox flaps its wings, a fine dust is scattered all over. This dust is actually a powerful poison that will even make a pro wrestler sick. This Pokémon searches for food using its antennae like radar.

pokemons.name: lotad
pokemons.description: Lotad is said to have dwelled on land before. However, this Pokémon is thought to have returned to water because the leaf on its head grew large and heavy. It now lives by floating atop the water.

pokemons.name: lombre
pokemons.description: Lombre’s entire body is covered by a slippery, slimy film. It feels horribly unpleasant to be touched by this Pokémon’s hands. Lombre is often mistaken for a human child.

pokemons.name: ludicolo
pokemons.description: Upon hearing an upbeat and cheerful rhythm, the cells in Ludicolo’s body become very energetic and active. Even in battle, this Pokémon will exhibit an amazing amount of power.

pokemons.name: seedot
pokemons.description: Seedot looks exactly like an acorn when it is dangling from a tree branch. It startles other Pokémon by suddenly moving. This Pokémon polishes its body once a day using leaves.

pokemons.name: nuzleaf
pokemons.description: This Pokémon pulls out the leaf on its head and makes a flute with it. The sound of Nuzleaf’s flute strikes fear and uncertainty in the hearts of people lost in a forest.

pokemons.name: shiftry
pokemons.description: Shiftry’s large fans generate awesome gusts of wind at a speed close to 100 feet per second. The whipped-up wind blows anything away. This Pokémon chooses to live quietly deep in forests.

pokemons.name: taillow
pokemons.description: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.

pokemons.name: swellow
pokemons.description: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other’s wings.

pokemons.name: wingull
pokemons.description: Fishermen keep an eye out for Wingull in the sky, because wherever they’re circling, the ocean is sure to be teeming with fish Pokémon.

pokemons.name: pelipper
pokemons.description: Gathering food is the work of young males. They store food in their capacious beaks and carry it back to others waiting in the nest.

pokemons.name: ralts
pokemons.description: Ralts has the ability to sense the emotions of people. If its Trainer is in a cheerful mood, this Pokémon grows cheerful and joyous in the same way.

pokemons.name: kirlia
pokemons.description: Kirlia uses the horns on its head to amplify its psychokinetic power. When the Pokémon uses its power, the air around it becomes distorted, creating mirages of nonexistent scenery.

pokemons.name: gardevoir
pokemons.description: Gardevoir has the psychokinetic power to distort the dimensions and create a small black hole. This Pokémon will try to protect its Trainer even at the risk of its own life.

pokemons.name: gardevoir-mega
pokemons.description: Gardevoir has the psychokinetic power to distort the dimensions and create a small black hole. This Pokémon will try to protect its Trainer even at the risk of its own life.

pokemons.name: surskit
pokemons.description: When this Pokémon senses danger, a sweet fluid oozes from the tip of its head. The taste of it disgusts bird Pokémon.

pokemons.name: masquerain
pokemons.description: Its wings and antennae don’t cope well with moisture. After a rain, it faces sunward to dry off.

pokemons.name: shroomish
pokemons.description: If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This Pokémon’s spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.

pokemons.name: breloom
pokemons.description: The seeds ringing Breloom’s tail are made of hardened toxic spores. It is horrible to eat the seeds. Just taking a bite of this Pokémon’s seed will cause your stomach to rumble.

pokemons.name: slakoth
pokemons.description: Slakoth’s heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.

pokemons.name: vigoroth
pokemons.description: Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this Pokémon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.

pokemons.name: slaking
pokemons.description: Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear in grassy fields. They are made by the Pokémon as it eats all the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.

pokemons.name: nincada
pokemons.description: Nincada lives underground. It uses its sharp claws to carve the roots of trees and absorb moisture and nutrients. This Pokémon can’t withstand bright sunlight so avoids it.

pokemons.name: ninjask
pokemons.description: If Ninjask is not trained properly, it will refuse to obey the Trainer and cry loudly continuously. Because of this quality, this Pokémon is said to be one that puts the Trainer’s abilities to the test.

pokemons.name: shedinja
pokemons.description: Shedinja is a peculiar Pokémon. It seems to appear unsought in a Poké Ball after a Nincada evolves. This bizarre Pokémon is entirely immobile—it doesn’t even breathe.

pokemons.name: whismur
pokemons.description: Whismur is very timid. If it starts to cry loudly, it becomes startled by its own crying and cries even harder. When it finally stops crying, the Pokémon goes to sleep, all tired out.

pokemons.name: loudred
pokemons.description: Loudred shouts while stamping its feet. After it finishes shouting, this Pokémon becomes incapable of hearing anything for a while. This is considered to be a weak point.

pokemons.name: exploud
pokemons.description: Exploud communicates its feelings to the others by emitting whistle-like sounds from the tubes on its body. This Pokémon only raises its voice when it is in battle.

pokemons.name: makuhita
pokemons.description: Their daily routine consists of training together first thing in the morning, eating and napping in the afternoon, and then more training afterward.

pokemons.name: hariyama
pokemons.description: They love to compare their freakish strength— strength enough to send a truck flying with a single slap.

pokemons.name: azurill
pokemons.description: Azurill’s tail is large and bouncy. It is packed full of the nutrients this Pokémon needs to grow. Azurill can be seen bouncing and playing on its big, rubbery tail.

pokemons.name: nosepass
pokemons.description: It uses powerful magnetism to drag its prey toward it. It’s also been known to pull in metal, which it collects and uses to protect itself.

pokemons.name: skitty
pokemons.description: Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.

pokemons.name: delcatty
pokemons.description: Delcatty sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent nest. If other Pokémon approach it as it sleeps, this Pokémon will never fight—it will just move away somewhere else.

pokemons.name: sableye
pokemons.description: This Pokémon is feared. When its gemstone eyes begin to glow with a sinister shine, it’s believed that Sableye will steal people’s spirits away.

pokemons.name: sableye-mega
pokemons.description: This Pokémon is feared. When its gemstone eyes begin to glow with a sinister shine, it’s believed that Sableye will steal people’s spirits away.

pokemons.name: mawile
pokemons.description: Don’t be taken in by this Pokémon’s cute face—it’s very dangerous. Mawile fools the foe into letting down its guard, then chomps down with its massive jaws. The steel jaws are really horns that have been transformed.

pokemons.name: mawile-mega
pokemons.description: Don’t be taken in by this Pokémon’s cute face—it’s very dangerous. Mawile fools the foe into letting down its guard, then chomps down with its massive jaws. The steel jaws are really horns that have been transformed.

pokemons.name: aron
pokemons.description: Aron has a body of steel. With one all-out charge, this Pokémon can demolish even a heavy dump truck. The destroyed dump truck then becomes a handy meal for the Pokémon.

pokemons.name: lairon
pokemons.description: Lairon feeds on iron contained in rocks and water. It makes its nest on mountains where iron ore is buried. As a result, the Pokémon often clashes with humans mining the iron ore.

pokemons.name: aggron
pokemons.description: Aggron is protective of its environment. If its mountain is ravaged by a landslide or a fire, this Pokémon will haul topsoil to the area, plant trees, and beautifully restore its own territory.

pokemons.name: aggron-mega
pokemons.description: Aggron is protective of its environment. If its mountain is ravaged by a landslide or a fire, this Pokémon will haul topsoil to the area, plant trees, and beautifully restore its own territory.

pokemons.name: meditite
pokemons.description: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon’s training.

pokemons.name: medicham
pokemons.description: Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon is known to meditate for a whole month without eating.

pokemons.name: medicham-mega
pokemons.description: Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon is known to meditate for a whole month without eating.

pokemons.name: electrike
pokemons.description: Electrike runs faster than the human eye can follow. The friction from running is converted into electricity, which is then stored in this Pokémon’s fur.

pokemons.name: manectric
pokemons.description: Manectric discharges strong electricity from its mane. The mane is used for collecting electricity in the atmosphere. This Pokémon creates thunderclouds above its head.

pokemons.name: manectric-mega
pokemons.description: Manectric discharges strong electricity from its mane. The mane is used for collecting electricity in the atmosphere. This Pokémon creates thunderclouds above its head.

pokemons.name: plusle
pokemons.description: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon cries loudly.

pokemons.name: minun
pokemons.description: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.

pokemons.name: volbeat
pokemons.description: Volbeat’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.

pokemons.name: illumise
pokemons.description: Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. This Pokémon is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.

pokemons.name: roselia
pokemons.description: On extremely rare occasions, a Roselia is said to appear with its flowers in unusual colors. The thorns on this Pokémon’s head contain a vicious poison.

pokemons.name: gulpin
pokemons.description: Most of Gulpin’s body is made up of its stomach—its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon’s stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.

pokemons.name: swalot
pokemons.description: Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokémon’s mouth.

pokemons.name: carvanha
pokemons.description: If they scent the faintest trace of blood, they rush to attack en masse. When alone, they’re rather cowardly.

pokemons.name: sharpedo
pokemons.description: It has a sad history. In the past, its dorsal fin was a treasured foodstuff, so this Pokémon became a victim of overfishing.

pokemons.name: sharpedo-mega
pokemons.description: It has a sad history. In the past, its dorsal fin was a treasured foodstuff, so this Pokémon became a victim of overfishing.

pokemons.name: wailmer
pokemons.description: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.

pokemons.name: wailord
pokemons.description: Its immense size is the reason for its popularity. Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing activity in various parts of the world.

pokemons.name: numel
pokemons.description: Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the Pokémon’s body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.

pokemons.name: camerupt
pokemons.description: The humps on Camerupt’s back are formed by a transformation of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma. This Pokémon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.

pokemons.name: camerupt-mega
pokemons.description: The humps on Camerupt’s back are formed by a transformation of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma. This Pokémon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.

pokemons.name: torkoal
pokemons.description: If the fire burning within its shell goes out, it will die. Those who wish to raise one in their home must always keep something flammable at hand.

pokemons.name: spoink
pokemons.description: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon’s psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.

pokemons.name: grumpig
pokemons.description: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This Pokémon’s black pearls are valuable as works of art.

pokemons.name: spinda
pokemons.description: Each and every Spinda has a slightly different configuration of spots. There are collectors who enjoy the tiny differences in their spot patterns.

pokemons.name: trapinch
pokemons.description: As it digs through the sand, its giant jaws crush any rocks that obstruct its path. It builds a funnel-shaped nest.

pokemons.name: vibrava
pokemons.description: To help make its wings grow, it dissolves quantities of prey in its digestive juices and guzzles them down every day.

pokemons.name: flygon
pokemons.description: This Pokémon hides in the heart of sandstorms it creates and seldom appears where people can see it.

pokemons.name: cacnea
pokemons.description: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokémon battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.

pokemons.name: cacturne
pokemons.description: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokémon are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.

pokemons.name: swablu
pokemons.description: Swablu loves to make things clean. If it spots something dirty, it will wipe and polish it with its cottony wings. If its wings become dirty, this Pokémon finds a stream and showers itself.

pokemons.name: altaria
pokemons.description: Altaria sings in a gorgeous soprano. Its wings are like cotton clouds. This Pokémon catches updrafts with its buoyant wings and soars way up into the wild blue yonder.

pokemons.name: altaria-mega
pokemons.description: Altaria sings in a gorgeous soprano. Its wings are like cotton clouds. This Pokémon catches updrafts with its buoyant wings and soars way up into the wild blue yonder.

pokemons.name: zangoose
pokemons.description: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.

pokemons.name: seviper
pokemons.description: Seviper’s swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.

pokemons.name: lunatone
pokemons.description: Lunatone becomes active around the time of the full moon. Instead of walking, it moves by floating in midair. The Pokémon’s intimidating red eyes cause all those who see it to become transfixed with fear.

pokemons.name: solrock
pokemons.description: Sunlight is the source of Solrock’s power. It is said to possess the ability to read the emotions of others. This Pokémon gives off intense heat while rotating its body.

pokemons.name: barboach
pokemons.description: Its slippery body is hard to grasp, so much so that there are festivals where people compete to see how many they can catch barehanded.

pokemons.name: whiscash
pokemons.description: Sighting Whiscash leaping from the water is believed to herald an earthquake.

pokemons.name: corphish
pokemons.description: Corphish catches prey with its sharp claws. It has no likes or dislikes when it comes to food—it will eat anything. This Pokémon has no trouble living in filthy water.

pokemons.name: crawdaunt
pokemons.description: Crawdaunt molts (sheds) its shell regularly. Immediately after molting, its shell is soft and tender. Until the shell hardens, this Pokémon hides in its streambed burrow to avoid attack from its foes.

pokemons.name: baltoy
pokemons.description: As soon as it spots others of its kind, Baltoy congregates with them and then begins crying noisily in unison. This Pokémon sleeps while cleverly balancing itself on its one foot.

pokemons.name: claydol
pokemons.description: Claydol is an enigma that appeared from a clay statue made by an ancient civilization dating back 20,000 years. This Pokémon shoots beams from both its hands.

pokemons.name: lileep
pokemons.description: Lileep is an ancient Pokémon that was regenerated from a fossil. It remains permanently anchored to a rock. From its immobile perch, this Pokémon intently scans for prey with its two eyes.

pokemons.name: cradily
pokemons.description: Cradily’s body serves as an anchor, preventing it from being washed away in rough seas. This Pokémon secretes a strong digestive fluid from its tentacles.

pokemons.name: anorith
pokemons.description: Anorith is said to be a type of Pokémon predecessor, with eight wings at the sides of its body. This Pokémon swam in the primordial sea by undulating these eight wings.

pokemons.name: armaldo
pokemons.description: Armaldo is a Pokémon species that became extinct in prehistoric times. This Pokémon is said to have walked on its hind legs, which would have been more convenient for life on land.

pokemons.name: feebas
pokemons.description: Although unattractive and unpopular, this Pokémon’s marvelous vitality has made it a subject of research.

pokemons.name: milotic
pokemons.description: It lives at the bottom of clear lakes. In times of war, it shows itself, which soothes people’s minds and hearts.

pokemons.name: castform
pokemons.description: Its form changes on its own, due to its cells’ sensitive reactions to temperature and humidity.

pokemons.name: castform-sunny
pokemons.description: Its form changes on its own, due to its cells’ sensitive reactions to temperature and humidity.

pokemons.name: castform-rainy
pokemons.description: Its form changes on its own, due to its cells’ sensitive reactions to temperature and humidity.

pokemons.name: castform-snowy
pokemons.description: Its form changes on its own, due to its cells’ sensitive reactions to temperature and humidity.

pokemons.name: kecleon
pokemons.description: Kecleon alters its body coloration to blend in with its surroundings, allowing it to sneak up on its prey unnoticed. Then it lashes out with its long, stretchy tongue to instantly ensnare the unsuspecting target.

pokemons.name: shuppet
pokemons.description: Shuppet grows by feeding on dark emotions, such as vengefulness and envy, in the hearts of people. It roams through cities in search of grudges that taint people.

pokemons.name: banette
pokemons.description: A cursed energy permeated the stuffing of a discarded and forgotten plush doll, giving it new life as Banette. The Pokémon’s energy would escape if it were to ever open its mouth.

pokemons.name: banette-mega
pokemons.description: A cursed energy permeated the stuffing of a discarded and forgotten plush doll, giving it new life as Banette. The Pokémon’s energy would escape if it were to ever open its mouth.

pokemons.name: duskull
