pokemons.description: Duskull wanders lost among the deep darkness of midnight. There is an oft-told admonishment given to misbehaving children that this Pokémon will spirit away bad children who earn scoldings from their mothers.

pokemons.name: dusclops
pokemons.description: Dusclops absorbs anything, however large the object may be. This Pokémon hypnotizes its foe by waving its hands in a macabre manner and by bringing its single eye to bear. The hypnotized foe is made to do Dusclops’s bidding.

pokemons.name: tropius
pokemons.description: Children of the southern tropics eat as snacks the fruit that grows in bunches around the neck of Tropius. This Pokémon flies by flapping the leaves on its back as if they were wings.

pokemons.name: chimecho
pokemons.description: In high winds, Chimecho cries as it hangs from a tree branch or the eaves of a building using a suction cup on its head. This Pokémon plucks berries with its long tail and eats them.

pokemons.name: absol
pokemons.description: Although it’s said to bring disaster, in actuality, this Pokémon possesses a calm disposition and warns people of any crises that loom.

pokemons.name: absol-mega
pokemons.description: Although it’s said to bring disaster, in actuality, this Pokémon possesses a calm disposition and warns people of any crises that loom.

pokemons.name: wynaut
pokemons.description: Wynaut gather on moonlit nights to play by squeezing up against each other. By being squeezed, this Pokémon gains endurance and is trained to dole out powerful counterattacks.

pokemons.name: snorunt
pokemons.description: It can only survive in cold areas. It bounces happily around, even in environments as cold as -150 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemons.name: glalie
pokemons.description: Its prey is instantaneously frozen stiff by the cold air it exhales from its huge mouth. While they’re in that frozen state, it gobbles them up.

pokemons.name: glalie-mega
pokemons.description: Its prey is instantaneously frozen stiff by the cold air it exhales from its huge mouth. While they’re in that frozen state, it gobbles them up.

pokemons.name: spheal
pokemons.description: Spheal always travels by rolling around on its ball-like body. When the season for ice floes arrives, this Pokémon can be seen rolling about on ice and crossing the sea.

pokemons.name: sealeo
pokemons.description: Sealeo often balances and rolls things on the tip of its nose. While the Pokémon is rolling something, it checks the object’s aroma and texture to determine whether it likes the object or not.

pokemons.name: walrein
pokemons.description: Walrein swims all over in frigid seawater while crushing icebergs with its grand, imposing tusks. Its thick layer of blubber makes enemy attacks bounce off harmlessly.

pokemons.name: clamperl
pokemons.description: Clamperl grows while being protected by its rock-hard shell. When its body becomes too large to fit inside the shell, it is sure evidence that this Pokémon is getting close to evolution.

pokemons.name: huntail
pokemons.description: Huntail’s tail is shaped like a fish. It uses the tail to attract prey, then swallows the prey whole with its large, gaping mouth. This Pokémon swims by wiggling its slender body like a snake.

pokemons.name: gorebyss
pokemons.description: Although Gorebyss is the very picture of elegance and beauty while swimming, it is also cruel. When it spots prey, this Pokémon inserts its thin mouth into the prey’s body and drains the prey of its body fluids.

pokemons.name: relicanth
pokemons.description: It was fortuitously discovered during a deep sea expedition. Its teeth have atrophied, so it now survives on microscopic organisms it sucks up.

pokemons.name: luvdisc
pokemons.description: Loving couples have a soft spot for this Pokémon, so honeymoon hotels often release this Pokémon into their pools.

pokemons.name: bagon
pokemons.description: With its steel-hard stone head, it headbutts indiscriminately. This is because of the stress it feels at being unable to fly.

pokemons.name: shelgon
pokemons.description: They lurk deep within caves—motionless, neither eating nor drinking. Why they don’t die is not known.

pokemons.name: salamence
pokemons.description: It flies around on its wings, which have grown in at last. In its happiness, it gushes hot flames, burning up the fields it passes over.

pokemons.name: salamence-mega
pokemons.description: It flies around on its wings, which have grown in at last. In its happiness, it gushes hot flames, burning up the fields it passes over.

pokemons.name: beldum
pokemons.description: With magnetic traction, it pulls its opponents in close. When they’re in range, it slashes them with its rear claws.

pokemons.name: metang
pokemons.description: It adores magnetic minerals, so it pursues Nosepass at speeds exceeding 60 mph.

pokemons.name: metagross
pokemons.description: A linkage of two Metang, this Pokémon can perform any calculation in a flash by utilizing parallel processing in its four brains.

pokemons.name: metagross-mega
pokemons.description: A linkage of two Metang, this Pokémon can perform any calculation in a flash by utilizing parallel processing in its four brains.

pokemons.name: regirock
pokemons.description: Regirock’s body is composed entirely of rocks. Recently, a study made the startling discovery that the rocks were all unearthed from different locations.

pokemons.name: regice
pokemons.description: Regice cloaks itself with frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit. Things will freeze solid just by going near this Pokémon. Its icy body is so cold, it will not melt even if it is immersed in magma.

pokemons.name: registeel
pokemons.description: Registeel was imprisoned by people in ancient times. The metal composing its body is thought to be a curious substance that is not of this earth.

pokemons.name: latias
pokemons.description: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.

pokemons.name: latias-mega
pokemons.description: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.

pokemons.name: latios
pokemons.description: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.

pokemons.name: latios-mega
pokemons.description: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.

pokemons.name: kyogre
pokemons.description: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.

pokemons.name: kyogre-primal
pokemons.description: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.

pokemons.name: groudon
pokemons.description: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.

pokemons.name: groudon-primal
pokemons.description: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.

pokemons.name: rayquaza
pokemons.description: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.

pokemons.name: rayquaza-mega
pokemons.description: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.

pokemons.name: jirachi
pokemons.description: Jirachi will awaken from its sleep of a thousand years if you sing to it in a voice of purity. It is said to make true any wish that people desire.

pokemons.name: deoxys-normal
pokemons.description: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.

pokemons.name: deoxys-attack
pokemons.description: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.

pokemons.name: deoxys-defense
pokemons.description: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.

pokemons.name: deoxys-speed
pokemons.description: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.

pokemons.name: turtwig
pokemons.description: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

pokemons.name: grotle
pokemons.description: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

pokemons.name: torterra
pokemons.description: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

pokemons.name: chimchar
pokemons.description: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

pokemons.name: monferno
pokemons.description: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

pokemons.name: infernape
pokemons.description: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

pokemons.name: piplup
pokemons.description: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

pokemons.name: prinplup
pokemons.description: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.

pokemons.name: empoleon
pokemons.description: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

pokemons.name: starly
pokemons.description: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

pokemons.name: staravia
pokemons.description: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.

pokemons.name: staraptor
pokemons.description: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.

pokemons.name: bidoof
pokemons.description: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

pokemons.name: bibarel
pokemons.description: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

pokemons.name: kricketot
pokemons.description: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

pokemons.name: kricketune
pokemons.description: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.

pokemons.name: shinx
pokemons.description: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

pokemons.name: luxio
pokemons.description: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

pokemons.name: luxray
pokemons.description: Luxray’s ability to see through objects comes in handy when it’s scouting for danger.

pokemons.name: budew
pokemons.description: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.

pokemons.name: roserade
pokemons.description: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.

pokemons.name: cranidos
pokemons.description: In rock layers where Cranidos fossils are found, the fossilized trunks of trees snapped in two are also often found.

pokemons.name: rampardos
pokemons.description: Records exist of a revived fossil that evolved into Rampardos. It proceeded to escape and then destroy a skyscraper with a headbutt.

pokemons.name: shieldon
pokemons.description: This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. Few enemies would have been willing to square off against its heavily armored face, so it’s thought.

pokemons.name: bastiodon
pokemons.description: It lived in the same environments as Rampardos. Their fossils have been found together— seemingly from after they’d fought to the finish.

pokemons.name: burmy
pokemons.description: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.

pokemons.name: wormadam-plant
pokemons.description: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

pokemons.name: wormadam-trash
pokemons.description: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

pokemons.name: wormadam-sandy
pokemons.description: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

pokemons.name: mothim
pokemons.description: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.

pokemons.name: combee
pokemons.description: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

pokemons.name: vespiquen
pokemons.description: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.

pokemons.name: pachirisu
pokemons.description: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

pokemons.name: buizel
pokemons.description: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

pokemons.name: floatzel
pokemons.description: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

pokemons.name: cherubi
pokemons.description: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.

pokemons.name: cherrim
pokemons.description: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun’s rays with its whole body.

pokemons.name: shellos
pokemons.description: Purple mucus sticks to the hands of anyone who touches it. Take care, as the substance is troublesome to wash off.

pokemons.name: gastrodon
pokemons.description: Plankton, invisible to the naked eye, is its main food source. It comes onto the land periodically, but the reason for this is not known.

pokemons.name: ambipom
pokemons.description: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.

pokemons.name: drifloon
pokemons.description: If for some reason its body bursts, its soul spills out with a screaming sound.

pokemons.name: drifblim
pokemons.description: Even while under careful observation, large flocks of Drifblim flying at dusk will inexplicably disappear from view.

pokemons.name: buneary
pokemons.description: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.

pokemons.name: lopunny
pokemons.description: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.

pokemons.name: lopunny-mega
pokemons.description: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.

pokemons.name: mismagius
pokemons.description: Mismagius have been known to cast spells to make people fall in love, so some people search for this Pokémon as if their life depended on it.

pokemons.name: honchkrow
pokemons.description: If its Murkrow cronies fail to catch food for it, or if it feels they have betrayed it, it will hunt them down wherever they are and punish them.

pokemons.name: glameow
pokemons.description: When it’s happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

pokemons.name: purugly
pokemons.description: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

pokemons.name: chingling
pokemons.description: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.

pokemons.name: stunky
pokemons.description: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

pokemons.name: skuntank
pokemons.description: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.

pokemons.name: bronzor
pokemons.description: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

pokemons.name: bronzong
pokemons.description: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

pokemons.name: bonsly
pokemons.description: From its eyes, it can expel excess moisture from its body. This liquid is similar in composition to human sweat.

pokemons.name: mime-jr
pokemons.description: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.

pokemons.name: happiny
pokemons.description: It’s too small to lay eggs yet. As a surrogate, it searches out round white stones.

pokemons.name: chatot
pokemons.description: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

pokemons.name: spiritomb
pokemons.description: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

pokemons.name: gible
pokemons.description: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.

pokemons.name: gabite
pokemons.description: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels it’s amassed or Carbink it has caught.

pokemons.name: garchomp
pokemons.description: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.

pokemons.name: garchomp-mega
pokemons.description: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.

pokemons.name: munchlax
pokemons.description: When it finds something that looks like it might be edible, it goes right ahead and swallows it whole. That’s why it gets fatter day by day.

pokemons.name: riolu
pokemons.description: It’s tough enough to run right through the night, and it’s also a hard worker, but it’s still just a youngster.

pokemons.name: lucario
pokemons.description: They can detect the species of a living being— and its emotions—from over half a mile away. They control auras and hunt their prey in packs.

pokemons.name: lucario-mega
pokemons.description: They can detect the species of a living being— and its emotions—from over half a mile away. They control auras and hunt their prey in packs.

pokemons.name: hippopotas
pokemons.description: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

pokemons.name: hippowdon
pokemons.description: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

pokemons.name: skorupi
pokemons.description: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

pokemons.name: drapion
pokemons.description: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

pokemons.name: croagunk
pokemons.description: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

pokemons.name: toxicroak
pokemons.description: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

pokemons.name: carnivine
pokemons.description: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

pokemons.name: finneon
pokemons.description: Its double tail fins propel its energetic jumps. When it breaks the surface of the sea, Wingull swoop down to grab it on the fly.

pokemons.name: lumineon
pokemons.description: This deep-sea Pokémon lives at the bottom of the sea. Its fins haul it over the seabed in search of its favorite food—Starmie.

pokemons.name: mantyke
pokemons.description: When it swims close to the surface of the ocean, people aboard ships are able to observe the pattern on its back.

pokemons.name: snover
pokemons.description: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

pokemons.name: abomasnow
pokemons.description: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

pokemons.name: abomasnow-mega
pokemons.description: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

pokemons.name: weavile
pokemons.description: They dwell in cold places. This Pokémon’s main food source in Alola is Vulpix and Sandshrew, which they carefully divide among their group.

pokemons.name: magnezone
pokemons.description: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

pokemons.name: lickilicky
pokemons.description: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.

pokemons.name: rhyperior
pokemons.description: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.

pokemons.name: tangrowth
pokemons.description: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can’t even see its eyes.

pokemons.name: electivire
pokemons.description: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.

pokemons.name: magmortar
pokemons.description: From its arm, it launches fireballs hotter than 3,500 degrees Fahrenheit. Its arm starts to melt when it fires a whole barrage.

pokemons.name: togekiss
pokemons.description: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.

pokemons.name: yanmega
pokemons.description: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

pokemons.name: leafeon
pokemons.description: The younger they are, the more they smell like fresh grass. With age, their fragrance takes on the odor of fallen leaves.

pokemons.name: glaceon
pokemons.description: It freezes its fur into icicles, spiky and sharp, and tackles its prey.

pokemons.name: gliscor
pokemons.description: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

pokemons.name: mamoswine
pokemons.description: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.

pokemons.name: porygon-z
pokemons.description: Its program was modified to facilitate extra-dimensional activities, but that led to noticeably strange behavior.

pokemons.name: gallade
pokemons.description: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.

pokemons.name: gallade-mega
pokemons.description: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.

pokemons.name: probopass
pokemons.description: The main body controls three mobile units called Mini-Noses, which it maneuvers to catch prey.

pokemons.name: dusknoir
pokemons.description: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

pokemons.name: froslass
pokemons.description: The soul of a woman lost on a snowy mountain possessed an icicle, becoming this Pokémon. The food it most relishes is the souls of men.

pokemons.name: rotom
pokemons.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

pokemons.name: rotom-heat
pokemons.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

pokemons.name: rotom-frost
pokemons.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

pokemons.name: rotom-wash
pokemons.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

pokemons.name: rotom-fan
pokemons.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

pokemons.name: rotom-mow
pokemons.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

pokemons.name: uxie
pokemons.description: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

pokemons.name: mesprit
pokemons.description: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.

pokemons.name: azelf
pokemons.description: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.

pokemons.name: dialga
pokemons.description: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

pokemons.name: palkia
pokemons.description: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

pokemons.name: heatran
pokemons.description: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

pokemons.name: regigigas
pokemons.description: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

pokemons.name: giratina-altered
pokemons.description: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

pokemons.name: giratina-origin
pokemons.description: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

pokemons.name: cresselia
pokemons.description: Those who sleep holding Cresselia’s feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

pokemons.name: phione
pokemons.description: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

pokemons.name: manaphy
pokemons.description: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

pokemons.name: darkrai
pokemons.description: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

pokemons.name: shaymin-land
pokemons.description: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

pokemons.name: shaymin-sky
pokemons.description: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

pokemons.name: arceus
pokemons.description: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.

pokemons.name: victini
pokemons.description: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.

pokemons.name: snivy
pokemons.description: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

pokemons.name: servine
pokemons.description: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

pokemons.name: serperior
pokemons.description: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

pokemons.name: tepig
pokemons.description: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

pokemons.name: pignite
pokemons.description: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

pokemons.name: emboar
pokemons.description: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

pokemons.name: oshawott
pokemons.description: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

pokemons.name: dewott
pokemons.description: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

pokemons.name: samurott
pokemons.description: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

pokemons.name: patrat
pokemons.description: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.

pokemons.name: watchog
pokemons.description: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

pokemons.name: lillipup
pokemons.description: The long fur surrounding its face functions as radar, enabling it to probe the condition of its battle opponents.

pokemons.name: herdier
pokemons.description: This Pokémon obeys its master’s orders faithfully. However, it refuses to listen to anything said by a person it doesn’t respect.

pokemons.name: stoutland
pokemons.description: With this wise Pokémon, there could be no concern that it would ever attack people. Some parents even trust it to babysit.

pokemons.name: purrloin
pokemons.description: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can’t help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

pokemons.name: liepard
pokemons.description: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.

pokemons.name: pansage
pokemons.description: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.

pokemons.name: simisage
pokemons.description: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

pokemons.name: pansear
pokemons.description: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemons.name: simisear
pokemons.description: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

pokemons.name: panpour
pokemons.description: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

pokemons.name: simipour
pokemons.description: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

pokemons.name: munna
pokemons.description: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.

pokemons.name: musharna
pokemons.description: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.

pokemons.name: pidove
pokemons.description: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.

pokemons.name: tranquill
pokemons.description: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.

pokemons.name: unfezant
pokemons.description: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.

pokemons.name: blitzle
pokemons.description: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

pokemons.name: zebstrika
pokemons.description: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

pokemons.name: roggenrola
pokemons.description: The hexagonal cavity is its ear. It walks in the direction of sounds it hears, but if the sounds cease, it panics and topples over.

pokemons.name: boldore
pokemons.description: It explores caves in search of underground water. It’s not comfortable around water, so this Pokémon takes great care in lapping it up.

pokemons.name: gigalith
pokemons.description: Known for its hefty horsepower, this Pokémon is a popular partner for construction workers.

pokemons.name: woobat
pokemons.description: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.

pokemons.name: swoobat
pokemons.description: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

pokemons.name: drilbur
pokemons.description: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.

pokemons.name: excadrill
pokemons.description: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

pokemons.name: audino
pokemons.description: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

pokemons.name: audino-mega
pokemons.description: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

pokemons.name: timburr
pokemons.description: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.

pokemons.name: gurdurr
pokemons.description: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

pokemons.name: conkeldurr
pokemons.description: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.

pokemons.name: tympole
pokemons.description: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

pokemons.name: palpitoad
pokemons.description: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

pokemons.name: seismitoad
pokemons.description: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

pokemons.name: throh
pokemons.description: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.

pokemons.name: sawk
pokemons.description: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

pokemons.name: sewaddle
pokemons.description: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

pokemons.name: swadloon
pokemons.description: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

pokemons.name: leavanny
pokemons.description: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

pokemons.name: venipede
pokemons.description: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

pokemons.name: whirlipede
pokemons.description: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.

pokemons.name: scolipede
pokemons.description: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

pokemons.name: cottonee
pokemons.description: Pillows and beds stuffed with cotton exhaled by Cottonee are soft and puffy, light and airy— altogether top quality.

pokemons.name: whimsicott
pokemons.description: This Pokémon appears, riding upon the wind. But if the wind gusts up, it’ll blow the cotton on this Pokémon’s head clean off.

pokemons.name: petilil
pokemons.description: By pruning the leaves on its head with regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into a fine plump shape.

pokemons.name: lilligant
pokemons.description: As soon as it finds a male to be its partner, the beautiful flower on its head darkens, droops, and withers away.

pokemons.name: basculin-red-striped
pokemons.description: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other’s school.

pokemons.name: basculin-blue-striped
pokemons.description: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other’s school.

pokemons.name: sandile
pokemons.description: It conceals itself in the sand and chomps down on the legs of any prey that unwarily walk over it. Its favorite food is Trapinch.

pokemons.name: krokorok
pokemons.description: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.

pokemons.name: krookodile
pokemons.description: After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.

pokemons.name: darumaka
pokemons.description: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemons.name: darmanitan-standard
pokemons.description: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

pokemons.name: darmanitan-zen
pokemons.description: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

pokemons.name: maractus
pokemons.description: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

pokemons.name: dwebble
pokemons.description: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.

pokemons.name: crustle
pokemons.description: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

pokemons.name: scraggy
pokemons.description: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.

pokemons.name: scrafty
pokemons.description: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.

pokemons.name: sigilyph
pokemons.description: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.

pokemons.name: yamask
pokemons.description: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

pokemons.name: cofagrigus
pokemons.description: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

pokemons.name: tirtouga
pokemons.description: Reputed to be the ancestor of most turtle Pokémon, it lived in warm seas approximately a hundred million years ago.

pokemons.name: carracosta
pokemons.description: Active both on land and in the sea, this Pokémon drags its land-based prey into the water to finish it off.

pokemons.name: archen
pokemons.description: To all appearances flightless, it was able to glide down from tall treetops to snag its prey.

pokemons.name: archeops
pokemons.description: They hunted in flocks. When one Archeops had the prey cornered, another would swoop on it.

pokemons.name: trubbish
pokemons.description: It gorges on trash until its stomach is full. Then it belches toxic gas. An unlucky whiff of gas will put a person in the hospital.

pokemons.name: garbodor
pokemons.description: For a time, their numbers increased explosively in Alola. Since the arrival of Grimer, their population has decreased dramatically.

pokemons.name: zorua
pokemons.description: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

pokemons.name: zoroark
pokemons.description: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

pokemons.name: minccino
pokemons.description: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.

pokemons.name: cinccino
pokemons.description: Cinccino’s body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.

pokemons.name: gothita
pokemons.description: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

pokemons.name: gothorita
pokemons.description: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.

pokemons.name: gothitelle
pokemons.description: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers’ life spans.

pokemons.name: solosis
pokemons.description: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

pokemons.name: duosion
pokemons.description: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.

pokemons.name: reuniclus
pokemons.description: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

pokemons.name: ducklett
pokemons.description: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

pokemons.name: swanna
pokemons.description: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

pokemons.name: vanillite
pokemons.description: It feels pleasantly cool when embraced. This Pokémon is treasured by households in warm regions.

pokemons.name: vanillish
pokemons.description: This Pokémon has existed since the Ice Age. It controls particles of ice, freezes its opponents, and then shatters them with a headbutt.

pokemons.name: vanilluxe
pokemons.description: Even if it loses one of its heads, it can live relatively problem-free. It makes snow clouds inside its body.

pokemons.name: deerling
pokemons.description: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

pokemons.name: sawsbuck
pokemons.description: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

pokemons.name: emolga
pokemons.description: It grills berries and bug Pokémon with electric shocks and makes a meal of them. It usually nests in the holes gouged in trees by Pikipek.

pokemons.name: karrablast
pokemons.description: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.

pokemons.name: escavalier
pokemons.description: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.

pokemons.name: foongus
pokemons.description: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.

pokemons.name: amoonguss
pokemons.description: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.

pokemons.name: frillish
pokemons.description: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.

pokemons.name: jellicent
pokemons.description: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.

pokemons.name: alomomola
pokemons.description: They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokémon gather in the area around Alomomola.

pokemons.name: joltik
pokemons.description: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

pokemons.name: galvantula
pokemons.description: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

pokemons.name: ferroseed
pokemons.description: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.

pokemons.name: ferrothorn
pokemons.description: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

pokemons.name: klink
pokemons.description: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

pokemons.name: klang
pokemons.description: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn’t return, it will die.

pokemons.name: klinklang
pokemons.description: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

pokemons.name: tynamo
pokemons.description: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

pokemons.name: eelektrik
pokemons.description: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

pokemons.name: eelektross
pokemons.description: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

pokemons.name: elgyem
pokemons.description: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.

pokemons.name: beheeyem
pokemons.description: It uses psychic power to control an opponent’s brain and tamper with its memories.

pokemons.name: litwick
pokemons.description: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

pokemons.name: lampent
pokemons.description: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

pokemons.name: chandelure
pokemons.description: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

pokemons.name: axew
pokemons.description: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

pokemons.name: fraxure
pokemons.description: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

pokemons.name: haxorus
pokemons.description: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

pokemons.name: cubchoo
pokemons.description: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.

pokemons.name: beartic
pokemons.description: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.

pokemons.name: cryogonal
pokemons.description: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemons.name: shelmet
pokemons.description: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.

pokemons.name: accelgor
pokemons.description: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

pokemons.name: stunfisk
pokemons.description: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

pokemons.name: mienfoo
pokemons.description: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.

pokemons.name: mienshao
pokemons.description: Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it launches into combo attacks that, once started, no one can stop.

pokemons.name: druddigon
pokemons.description: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.

pokemons.name: golett
pokemons.description: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It’s been active for thousands of years.

pokemons.name: golurk
pokemons.description: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

pokemons.name: pawniard
pokemons.description: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.

pokemons.name: bisharp
pokemons.description: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.

pokemons.name: bouffalant
pokemons.description: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

pokemons.name: rufflet
pokemons.description: With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, it’s a carnivore at heart.

pokemons.name: braviary
pokemons.description: It’s thought that people disturbed their habitats in the past, so Braviary banded together to fight back.

pokemons.name: vullaby
pokemons.description: It can’t fly yet and must wait until its wings have developed more. Since it’s still at a playful age, it hops around friskily.

pokemons.name: mandibuzz
pokemons.description: It circles in the sky, keeping a keen eye out for Pokémon in a weakened state. Its choicest food is Cubone.

pokemons.name: heatmor
pokemons.description: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.

pokemons.name: durant
pokemons.description: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

pokemons.name: deino
pokemons.description: Lacking sight, it’s unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

pokemons.name: zweilous
pokemons.description: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

pokemons.name: hydreigon
pokemons.description: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!

pokemons.name: larvesta
pokemons.description: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.

pokemons.name: volcarona
pokemons.description: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona’s fire provided a replacement for the sun.

pokemons.name: cobalion
pokemons.description: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.

pokemons.name: terrakion
pokemons.description: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon.

pokemons.name: virizion
pokemons.description: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.

pokemons.name: tornadus-incarnate
pokemons.description: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

pokemons.name: tornadus-therian
pokemons.description: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

pokemons.name: thundurus-incarnate
pokemons.description: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

pokemons.name: thundurus-therian
pokemons.description: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

pokemons.name: reshiram
pokemons.description: When Reshiram’s tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world’s weather.

pokemons.name: zekrom
pokemons.description: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

pokemons.name: landorus-incarnate
pokemons.description: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.

pokemons.name: landorus-therian
pokemons.description: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.

pokemons.name: kyurem
pokemons.description: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

pokemons.name: kyurem-white
pokemons.description: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

pokemons.name: kyurem-black
pokemons.description: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

pokemons.name: keldeo-ordinary
pokemons.description: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

pokemons.name: keldeo-resolute
pokemons.description: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

pokemons.name: meloetta-aria
pokemons.description: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

pokemons.name: meloetta-pirouette
pokemons.description: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

pokemons.name: genesect
pokemons.description: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

pokemons.name: chespin
pokemons.description: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.

pokemons.name: quilladin
pokemons.description: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.

pokemons.name: chesnaught
pokemons.description: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

pokemons.name: fennekin
pokemons.description: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

pokemons.name: braixen
pokemons.description: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

pokemons.name: delphox
pokemons.description: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

pokemons.name: froakie
pokemons.description: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

pokemons.name: frogadier
pokemons.description: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.

pokemons.name: greninja
pokemons.description: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

pokemons.name: bunnelby
pokemons.description: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

pokemons.name: diggersby
pokemons.description: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it’s finished digging, it lounges lazily.

pokemons.name: fletchling
pokemons.description: When it’s excited, its temperature can double, spiking hormone production in its body.

pokemons.name: fletchinder
pokemons.description: It will not tolerate other Fletchinder entering its territory, which has a radius of several miles.

pokemons.name: talonflame
pokemons.description: It zooms directly at its prey at flight speeds of close to 310 mph, while fiery embers scatter from gaps in its feathers.

pokemons.name: scatterbug
pokemons.description: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

pokemons.name: spewpa
pokemons.description: The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

pokemons.name: vivillon
pokemons.description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

pokemons.name: litleo
pokemons.description: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.

pokemons.name: pyroar
pokemons.description: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride’s cubs.

pokemons.name: flabebe
pokemons.description: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind’s embrace with an untroubled heart.

pokemons.name: floette
pokemons.description: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.

pokemons.name: floette-eternal
pokemons.description: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.

pokemons.name: florges
pokemons.description: In times long past, governors of castles would invite Florges to create flower gardens to embellish the castle domains.

pokemons.name: skiddo
pokemons.description: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

pokemons.name: gogoat
pokemons.description: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

pokemons.name: pancham
pokemons.description: There’s no point to the leaf in its mouth, aside from an effort to look cool. It’s mischievous, so it’s not well suited to inexperienced Trainers.

pokemons.name: pangoro
pokemons.description: From the slight twitches of its bamboo leaf, it deduces its opponent’s movements. It’s eager to tussle but kindhearted toward its companions.

pokemons.name: furfrou
pokemons.description: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémon were the designated guardians of the king.

pokemons.name: espurr
pokemons.description: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.

pokemons.name: meowstic-male
pokemons.description: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.

pokemons.name: meowstic-female
pokemons.description: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.

pokemons.name: honedge
pokemons.description: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person’s arm and drains that person’s life energy completely.

pokemons.name: doublade
pokemons.description: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

pokemons.name: aegislash-shield
pokemons.description: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

pokemons.name: aegislash-blade
pokemons.description: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

pokemons.name: spritzee
pokemons.description: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.

pokemons.name: aromatisse
pokemons.description: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.

pokemons.name: swirlix
pokemons.description: Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.

pokemons.name: slurpuff
pokemons.description: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a human’s, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. It’s like it can see with its nose!

pokemons.name: inkay
pokemons.description: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent’s will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

pokemons.name: malamar
pokemons.description: It lures its prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.

pokemons.name: binacle
pokemons.description: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.

pokemons.name: barbaracle
pokemons.description: Barbaracle’s legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head’s orders.

pokemons.name: skrelp
pokemons.description: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.

pokemons.name: dragalge
pokemons.description: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.

pokemons.name: clauncher
pokemons.description: Through controlled explosions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.

pokemons.name: clawitzer
pokemons.description: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.

pokemons.name: helioptile
pokemons.description: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.

pokemons.name: heliolisk
pokemons.description: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.

pokemons.name: tyrunt
pokemons.description: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.

pokemons.name: tyrantrum
pokemons.description: Nothing could stop this Pokémon 100 million years ago, so it behaved like a king.

pokemons.name: amaura
pokemons.description: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.

pokemons.name: aurorus
pokemons.description: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent’s attack.

pokemons.name: sylveon
pokemons.description: When this Pokémon sights its prey, it swirls its ribbonlike feelers as a distraction. A moment later, it pounces.

pokemons.name: hawlucha
pokemons.description: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.

pokemons.name: dedenne
pokemons.description: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

pokemons.name: carbink
pokemons.description: Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.

pokemons.name: goomy
pokemons.description: Its source of protection is its slimy, germ-laden mucous membrane. Anyone who touches it needs some thorough hand-washing.

pokemons.name: sliggoo
pokemons.description: This Pokémon’s mucous can dissolve anything. Toothless, it sprays mucous on its prey. Once they’re nicely dissolved, it slurps them up.

pokemons.name: goodra
pokemons.description: It gets picked on because it’s meek. But then, whoever teased it gets to feel the full force of its horns and a good swatting from its thick tail.

pokemons.name: klefki
pokemons.description: It inserts its horn into chinks in metal, absorbing metal ions. For some reason, it collects keys.

pokemons.name: phantump
pokemons.description: According to legend, medicine to cure any illness can be made by plucking the green leaves on its head, brewing them, and boiling down the liquid.

pokemons.name: trevenant
pokemons.description: Through its roots, it exerts control over other trees. A deadly curse falls upon anyone cutting down trees in forests where Trevenant dwell.

pokemons.name: pumpkaboo-average
pokemons.description: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.

pokemons.name: pumpkaboo-small
pokemons.description: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.

pokemons.name: pumpkaboo-super
pokemons.description: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.

pokemons.name: pumpkaboo-large
pokemons.description: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.

pokemons.name: gourgeist-average
pokemons.description: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.

pokemons.name: gourgeist-small
pokemons.description: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.

pokemons.name: gourgeist-large
pokemons.description: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.

pokemons.name: gourgeist-super
pokemons.description: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.

pokemons.name: bergmite
pokemons.description: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

pokemons.name: avalugg
pokemons.description: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.

pokemons.name: noibat
pokemons.description: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.

pokemons.name: noivern
pokemons.description: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.

pokemons.name: xerneas
pokemons.description: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

pokemons.name: yveltal
pokemons.description: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

pokemons.name: zygarde
pokemons.description: It’s thought to be monitoring the ecosystem. There are rumors that even greater power lies hidden within it.

pokemons.name: diancie
pokemons.description: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

pokemons.name: diancie-mega
pokemons.description: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

pokemons.name: hoopa
pokemons.description: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

pokemons.name: hoopa-unbound
pokemons.description: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

pokemons.name: volcanion
pokemons.description: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

pokemons.name: rowlet
pokemons.description: Silently it glides, drawing near its targets. Before they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with vicious kicks.

pokemons.name: dartrix
pokemons.description: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.

pokemons.name: decidueye
pokemons.description: Although basically cool and cautious, when it’s caught by surprise, it’s seized by panic.

pokemons.name: litten
pokemons.description: It doesn’t allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.

pokemons.name: torracat
pokemons.description: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.

pokemons.name: incineroar
pokemons.description: After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.

pokemons.name: popplio
pokemons.description: This Pokémon can control water bubbles. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.

pokemons.name: brionne
pokemons.description: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.

pokemons.name: primarina
pokemons.description: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokémon’s Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.

pokemons.name: pikipek
pokemons.description: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.

pokemons.name: trumbeak
pokemons.description: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.

pokemons.name: toucannon
pokemons.description: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.

pokemons.name: yungoos
pokemons.description: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.

pokemons.name: gumshoos
pokemons.description: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as it’s diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokémon boasts incredible patience.

pokemons.name: grubbin
pokemons.description: They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokémon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokémon.

pokemons.name: charjabug
pokemons.description: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.

pokemons.name: vikavolt
pokemons.description: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.

pokemons.name: crabrawler
pokemons.description: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.

pokemons.name: crabominable
pokemons.description: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.

pokemons.name: oricorio-baile
pokemons.description: This Oricorio has sipped red nectar. Its passionate dance moves cause its enemies to combust in both body and mind.

pokemons.name: cutiefly
pokemons.description: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.

pokemons.name: ribombee
pokemons.description: Some of Ribombee’s pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.

pokemons.name: rockruff
pokemons.description: This Pokémon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer’s side.

pokemons.name: lycanroc-midday
pokemons.description: When properly raised from a young age, it will become a trustworthy partner that will absolutely never betray its Trainer.

pokemons.name: wishiwashi-solo
pokemons.description: It’s awfully weak and notably tasty, so everyone is always out to get it. As it happens, anyone trying to bully it receives a painful lesson.

pokemons.name: mareanie
pokemons.description: It’s found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola’s head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokémon.

pokemons.name: toxapex
pokemons.description: Those attacked by Toxapex’s poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.

pokemons.name: mudbray
pokemons.description: It has a stubborn, individualistic disposition. Eating dirt, making mud, and playing in the mire all form part of its daily routine.

pokemons.name: mudsdale
pokemons.description: Its heavy, mud-covered kicks are its best means of attack, and it can reduce large trucks to scrap without breaking a sweat.

pokemons.name: dewpider
pokemons.description: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokémon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.

pokemons.name: araquanid
pokemons.description: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokémon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.

pokemons.name: fomantis
pokemons.description: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.

pokemons.name: lurantis
pokemons.description: It fires beams from its sickle-shaped petals. These beams are powerful enough to cleave through thick metal plates.

pokemons.name: morelull
pokemons.description: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.

pokemons.name: shiinotic
pokemons.description: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.

pokemons.name: salandit
pokemons.description: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokémon, then attacks them.

pokemons.name: salazzle
pokemons.description: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.

pokemons.name: stufful
pokemons.description: A touch from anyone except a known friend sends it into a surging frenzy. It’s an incredibly dangerous Pokémon.

pokemons.name: bewear
pokemons.description: This Pokémon has the habit of hugging its companions. Many Trainers have left this world after their spines were squashed by its hug.

pokemons.name: bounsweet
pokemons.description: Although it’s too sugary for human consumption, Bounsweet’s sweat can be watered down into a juice with just the right amount of sweetness.

pokemons.name: steenee
pokemons.description: This Pokémon is always bouncing around energetically. Other Pokémon are attracted by its lively appearance and pleasant aroma.

pokemons.name: tsareena
pokemons.description: A Pokémon known for the beauty of its well-shaped legs, it sometimes appears as a mascot in advertisements for beauty salons.

pokemons.name: comfey
pokemons.description: Baths prepared with the flowers from its vine have a relaxing effect, so this Pokémon is a hit with many people.

pokemons.name: oranguru
pokemons.description: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

pokemons.name: passimian
pokemons.description: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.

pokemons.name: wimpod
pokemons.description: Its habitat varies from beaches to seabeds. A natural scavenger, it will gleefully chow down on anything edible, no matter how rotten.

pokemons.name: golisopod
pokemons.description: It battles skillfully with its six arms, but spends most of its time peacefully meditating in caves deep beneath the sea.

pokemons.name: sandygast
pokemons.description: It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth. And so it adds to the accumulation of its sand-mound body.

pokemons.name: palossand
pokemons.description: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.

pokemons.name: pyukumuku
pokemons.description: These Pokémon line the beaches. The sticky mucous that covers their bodies can be used to soothe sunburned skin. How convenient!

pokemons.name: type-null
pokemons.description: Due to the danger that this synthetic Pokémon may go on a rampage, it wears a control mask to restrain its power.

pokemons.name: silvally
pokemons.description: Although its name was Type: Null at first, the boy who evolved it into this form gave it the name by which it is now known.

pokemons.name: minior-red-meteor
pokemons.description: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokémon was born from mutated nanoparticles.

pokemons.name: komala
pokemons.description: The log it holds was given to it by its parents at birth. It has also been known to cling to the arm of a friendly Trainer.

pokemons.name: turtonator
pokemons.description: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.

pokemons.name: togedemaru
pokemons.description: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.

pokemons.name: mimikyu-disguised
pokemons.description: A lonely Pokémon, it conceals its terrifying appearance beneath an old rag so it can get closer to people and other Pokémon.

pokemons.name: bruxish
pokemons.description: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder’s shell is no match for it.

pokemons.name: drampa
pokemons.description: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.

pokemons.name: dhelmise
pokemons.description: The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokémon. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.

pokemons.name: jangmo-o
pokemons.description: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. Jangmo-o grow little by little as they battle one another.

pokemons.name: hakamo-o
pokemons.description: It sheds and regrows its scales on a continuous basis. The scales become harder and sharper each time they’re regrown.

pokemons.name: kommo-o
pokemons.description: Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other commodities.

pokemons.name: tapu-koko
pokemons.description: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.

pokemons.name: tapu-lele
pokemons.description: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.

pokemons.name: tapu-bulu
pokemons.description: The guardian deity of Ula’ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.

pokemons.name: tapu-fini
pokemons.description: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.

pokemons.name: cosmog
pokemons.description: In ages past, it was called the child of the stars. It’s said to be a Pokémon from another world, but no specific details are known.

pokemons.name: cosmoem
pokemons.description: There’s something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokémon may come from another world.

pokemons.name: solgaleo
pokemons.description: This Pokémon is said to be a male evolution of Cosmog. At the activation of its third eye, it departs for another world.

pokemons.name: lunala
pokemons.description: Said to live in another world, this Pokémon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.

pokemons.name: nihilego
pokemons.description: One of the Ultra Beasts. It’s unclear whether or not this Pokémon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.

pokemons.name: buzzwole
pokemons.description: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.

pokemons.name: pheromosa
pokemons.description: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.

pokemons.name: xurkitree
pokemons.description: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.

pokemons.name: celesteela
pokemons.description: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.

pokemons.name: kartana
pokemons.description: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.

pokemons.name: guzzlord
pokemons.description: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.

pokemons.name: necrozma
pokemons.description: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It has an extraordinarily vicious disposition and is constantly firing off laser beams.

pokemons.name: magearna
pokemons.description: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.

pokemons.name: marshadow
pokemons.description: It lurks in the shadows of others, copying their movements and powers. This Pokémon is craven and cowering.
